law.catch_line: Liability when cattle break owner's fence and enter uninclosed land.
law.text: If the owner or bailee of cattle has a lawful fence, and his cattle break through or over his fence and upon the premises of another which are not inclosed by a lawful fence, he shall not be responsible for the first trespass, but shall be liable for all subsequent trespasses.
law.history: Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 1788.
